question.text: If when 58?,364 is rounded to the nearest thousand, the result is 58?,000, what could be the missing digit?

explanation1.text: You want to round to the thousands place, so look one place to the right:

explanation3.text: The digit one place to the right is a 6. As a result, we will be rounding down. So, 58?,364 rounds down to 58?,000.

explanation4.text: Because the missing digit becomes 3 after being rounded down, the missing digit must be 3.
